subject: Re: Tesing-testing
author: Fiona Broome
full_text:
Hi,

Frank, I love that you posted this.  That's the kind of logic that keeps me in this field.  These aren't simple dilemmas or logic problems... they're huge, possibly crossing dimensions.

Though grasping the full implications can be a continual challenge, I'm reminded of the sparkle in Sherlock Holmes' eye when he said, "The game is afoot!" 

(I'm even more amused by the more complete quotation from Shakespeare's play, Henry V: "The game's afoot!
Follow your spirit!")

I think we need to test every theory -- pushing each of them beyond "sensible" limits, in some cases -- to find new answers.

For me, this is tremendously exciting, and the "what if...?" questions get better & better.  Sure, maybe some (or many) of them lead nowhere, but they're such fun to explore!  

(And, if they shed even a tiny light on the real answers, that might be all we need to take the next step forward in the research.)

Like you, I think quantum studies are a major part of what we're trying to figure out.  This is such an exciting time!  I feel like I'm standing in front of a huge buffet of clues, and I'm considering how they might all fit together... or at least how to fit more of them on my plate to study them! *grin*

A month ago, I would have said that EVP was interesting, but nothing I'd pursue.  Having heard crystal clear voices, day after day, when I was in Canada... I'm hooked.  

The idea that you can take the English language radio stations out of the equation and still hear unmistakably clear phrases... wow!

Anyway, your post made me smile.  This is exactly what intrigues me about paranormal studies.

Thanks!

Cheerfully,
Fiona
